I love the idea of the Rangers as actual adults with jobs and stuff. And that job is being technicolor superheroes. But that's just one Squiggy's opinion.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552b44df636872754d032200#post_552b44df636872754d032200
Pretty much.

Neurologically speaking you can increase the percentage of you that is mechanical, but once you get those mechanical implants your brain tosses out the instructions on running the original organic parts like a high schooler who just went on spring break tossing out their homework for the semester.

To use an analogy there is *SEVERE* medical complications for whenever someone is on a pacemaker for years and then tries to get a heart transplant.  If you were to mechanize your entire body and then try to switch a natural one chances are you would die.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552b473e63687210474c0300#post_552b473e63687210474c0300
Nah I highly doubt it'll go generic "machine uprising" route or such, but rather humans will become machines.

Neural enhancements weren't supposed to even be theoretically possible for another 15 years and the DOD is already funding experimenting with it.  It's kind of weird because we're progressing technologically way too fast; like to the point that brain-machine interfaces were supposed to still be just ideas on napkins.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552b480763687259e6fd0f00#post_552b480763687259e6fd0f00
Again, super okay with this. Better to do ourselves in via progress than via nuclear explosions. 

Or worse, apathy
Imagine the whole world becomes Japan on steroids and nobody wants to breed
For every baby there are 100 people over 50
That would be the most anticlimactic extinction ever. 
I mean I think it's unlikely to happen considering how many soccer moms with several broods of children I see at wal mart but still
